clusterList.phrase: oh because at st david's we don't do heart transplants
well we need to do a heart biopsy and the ones who do that are the doctors who handle transplants

but i'm also not just going in there until you know the risks so in a transplant patient to do a biopsy of the heart to see if they're rejecting it isn't a big deal but with you phil the risk is five-fold and it's by no means a simple little procedure if you want i can go in there and biopsy but when i do that the heart can tear and make a hole which well isn't good see the heart is like steak you know how a flank steak can just tear well essentially i'm going in there and taking bites out of your heart i'm telling you all of this because you need to know the risks and some people would rather not have the biopsies they'd rather not know what's going on
